alert.note: Alert for Gallia; Meigs (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Meigs, northeastern Gallia and north central Mason Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rutland, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pomeroy, Rutland, New Haven, Mason, Middleport, Syracuse, Hartford City, Cheshire, Lakin, Dyesville, Harrisonville, Dexter, Carpenter and Kyger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
